content.description: A company conducted a charity drive and recorded the donations made by the employees of two departments, A and B. The back-to-back stemplot below shows the amounts given by the employees from department A and the amounts given by the employees from department B.

vertical bar 5" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>7</mn> <mo>|</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> represents <math alttext="$75" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>$</mi> <mn>75</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> Based on the back-to-back stemplot, which of the following is correct?

choices.label: The variability of the donations for the employees from department A is less than the variability of the donations for the employees from department B.
The median donation for the employees from department A is greater than the median donation for the employees from department B.
The shape of the distribution of donations for each department is skewed left.

The number of employees from department A who donated at most <math alttext="$35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than the number of employees from department B who donated at most <math alttext="$35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The number of employees from department A who donated <math alttext="$50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than the number of employees from department B who donated <math alttext="$50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The median donation for the employees from department A is greater than the median donation for the employees from department B.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
